Chicken soup is one of the best foods to eat when you have a cold. It is a good source of protein and vitamins, and the hot broth helps to soothe a sore throat. The soup also helps to thin mucus, making it easier to expel.

Chicken soup is a traditional remedy for colds and flu, as it is high in protein, vitamins and minerals. The hot liquid helps to thin out mucus and provides hydration, while the steam helps to open up the nasal passages.
